verses.kjv: And after this it came to pass that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them: and David took Methegammah out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.web: After this, David struck the Philistines and subdued them; and David took the bridle of the mother city out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.ct: After this, David attacked the Philistines and brought them under his control. He seized Methegammah from Philistine hands.

verses.kjv: And he smote Moab, and measured them with a line, casting them down to the ground; even with two lines measured he to put to death, and with one full line to keep alive. And so the Moabites became David’s servants, and brought gifts.
verses.web: He struck Moab, and measured them with the line, making them to lie down on the ground; and he measured two lines to put to death, and one full line to keep alive. The Moabites became servants to David, and brought tribute.
verses.ct: He also defeated Moab. He made the captured soldiers lie down on the ground and measured them off with a line — 2 out of every 3 were put to death, and the remaining third were spared. The Moabites became David's subjects and paid him tribute.

verses.kjv: David smote also Hadadezer, the son of Rehob, king of Zobah, as he went to recover his border at the river Euphrates.
verses.web: David struck also Hadadezer the son of Rehob, king of Zobah, as he went to recover his dominion at the River.
verses.ct: David also defeated Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah, as Hadadezer was trying to restore his control along the Euphrates River.

verses.kjv: And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven hundred horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: and David houghed all the chariot horses, but reserved of them for an hundred chariots.
verses.web: David took from him one thousand seven hundred horsemen and twenty thousand footmen. David hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved of them for one hundred chariots.
verses.ct: David captured 1,000 chariots, 700 horsemen, and 20,000 foot soldiers from him. He hamstrung all the chariot horses except enough to pull 100 chariots.

verses.kjv: And when the Syrians of Damascus came to succour Hadadezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.
verses.web: When the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck twenty two thousand men of the Syrians.
verses.ct: When the Syrians from Damascus came to help King Hadadezer of Zobah, David killed 22,000 of them.

verses.kjv: Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus: and the Syrians became servants to David, and brought gifts. And the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.
verses.web: Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became servants to David, and brought tribute. LORD gave victory to David wherever he went.
verses.ct: David then stationed garrisons throughout Syrian Damascus. The Syrians became his subjects and paid him tribute. The LORD gave David victory wherever he went.

verses.kjv: And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.web: David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: David took the gold shields carried by Hadadezer's officers and brought them back to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And from Betah, and from Berothai, cities of Hadadezer, king David took exceeding much brass.
verses.web: From Betah and from Berothai, cities of Hadadezer, king David took a great quantity of bronze.
verses.ct: From Betah and Berothai, cities belonging to Hadadezer, King David also took a massive amount of bronze.

verses.kjv: When Toi king of Hamath heard that David had smitten all the host of Hadadezer,
verses.web: When Toi king of Hamath heard that David had struck all the army of Hadadezer,
verses.ct: When King Toi of Hamath heard that David had crushed Hadadezer's entire army,

verses.kjv: Then Toi sent Joram his son unto king David, to salute him, and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer, and smitten him: for Hadadezer had wars with Toi. And Joram brought with him vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and vessels of brass:
verses.web: then Toi sent Joram his son to king David, to greet him, and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer and struck him; for Hadadezer had wars with Toi. Joram brought with him vessels of silver, vessels of gold, and vessels of bronze.
verses.ct: he sent his son Joram to King David to congratulate him and praise him for his victory, since Hadadezer had been Toi's enemy as well. Joram brought gifts of silver, gold, and bronze vessels.

verses.kjv: Which also king David did dedicate unto the LORD, with the silver and gold that he had dedicated of all nations which he subdued;
verses.web: King David also dedicated these to LORD, with the silver and gold that he dedicated of all the nations which he subdued;
verses.ct: King David dedicated all of these to the LORD, along with the silver and gold he had set apart from every nation he conquered —

verses.kjv: Of Syria, and of Moab, and of the children of Ammon, and of the Philistines, and of Amalek, and of the spoil of Hadadezer, son of Rehob, king of Zobah.
verses.web: of Syria, of Moab, of the children of Ammon, of the Philistines, of Amalek, and of the plunder of Hadadezer, son of Rehob, king of Zobah.
verses.ct: from Syria, Moab, the Ammonites, the Philistines, and Amalek, as well as from the plunder taken from Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah.

verses.kjv: And David gat him a name when he returned from smiting of the Syrians in the valley of salt, being eighteen thousand men.
verses.web: David earned a reputation when he returned from striking down eighteen thousand men of the Syrians in the Valley of Salt.
verses.ct: David's fame grew even greater when he returned from striking down 18,000 men in the Valley of Salt.

verses.kjv: And he put garrisons in Edom; throughout all Edom put he garrisons, and all they of Edom became David’s servants. And the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.
verses.web: He put garrisons in Edom. Throughout all Edom, he put garrisons, and all the Edomites became servants to David. LORD gave victory to David wherever he went.
verses.ct: He stationed garrisons throughout all of Edom, and every Edomite became his subject. The LORD gave David victory wherever he went.

verses.kjv: And David reigned over all Israel; and David executed judgment and justice unto all his people.
verses.web: David reigned over all Israel; and David executed justice and righteousness for all his people.
verses.ct: David ruled over all of Israel, and he governed his people with justice and fairness.

verses.kjv: And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;
verses.web: Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army, Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder,
verses.ct: Joab son of Zeruiah commanded the army, and Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud served as the royal recorder.

verses.kjv: And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, were the priests; and Seraiah was the scribe;
verses.web: Zadok the son of Ahitub and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar were priests, Seraiah was scribe,
verses.ct: Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar served as priests, and Seraiah was the royal scribe.

verses.kjv: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over both the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David’s sons were chief rulers.
verses.web: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and David’s sons were chief ministers.
verses.ct: Benaiah son of Jehoiada commanded the Cherethites and Pelethites, and David's sons served as chief officials.
